Are you sure about creating a new Instant each time?
Could it be better to chose a fixed instant away from known special dates for instance to avoid leap-second, February and daylight saving changes?

Leap seconds are not supported by Unix timestamp. We don't use any particular timezone here so it is UTC which does not has daylight saving time. There can be a point with February but 1970 is not a leap year so that would only applies for durations > 2 years and that's not very impactful on our index hint.

While you're right about leap seconds (Joda doesn't even support it) and daylight saving time, there are still 2 issues:

new Instant() is set to the system current milliseconds, so if you have a period of 1 month and you run that in February, you won't have the same result as if you run than in January.
You are instantiating an object each time while a single instance (static or not) should be enough.
